Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gift \Gift\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Gifted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Gifting}.] To endow with some power or faculty. See {gift}[4]. [1913 Webster]
He was gifted . . . with philosophical sagacity. --I. Taylor. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
gifted \gifted\ adj. [Cf. See {gift}[4] and {gift}, v. t..] 1. having unusual talent in some field.
Syn: talented. [PJC]
2. having exceptionally high intelligence; -- said of children, especially in discourse on education; as, a program for gifted children. [PJC]
gifted adj : showing a natural aptitude for something [syn: {talented}]
